newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar prices fall on new arrivals.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar prices fall on new arrivals.

text.p: Indian sugar prices fell on Tuesday on low consumer demand and new improved arrivals, dealers said.
Outstation demand at the mill level eased, triggering higher offerings by mills which saw more arrivals in the local market.

In ready delivery sugar S-30 fell by 10/16 rupees to 1,235/1,265 rupees while sugar M-30 eased by 4/5 rupees to 1,260/1,315 rupees. Sugar mill delivery also lost the gained ground and fell to 1,170/1,180 rupees from 1,180/1,205 rupees.
Overall volumes remained low and sentiments was subdued at the close of the session.
